import pow.kml in data folder 

```{r}
pacman::p_load(sf, tmap, tidyverse, lubridate, dplyr)
```

```{r}
kml <- "data/pow.kml"
```
read all the layers in pow.kml file

```{r}
layer_info <- st_layers(kml)
```

```{r}
layer_info
```


```{r}
# Define the layer names based on the provided information
layer_names <- c("Mosques", "Taoist/Buddhist Temples", "Churches", "Hindu Temples", "Gurdwaras", "Synagogues", "Others", "Future")

# Loop through each layer name
for (layer_name in layer_names) {
  # Read the layer
  assign(layer_name, st_read(kml, layer = layer_name))
}
```
